pullRequest.body:
This PR (done by Markus Himmel, with minor clean-up from Quang Dao) introduces fast modular exponentiation to the `reduce_mod_char` tactic. This allows for exponentiating large number reduced modulo `n` for some `n`. An example is:
```
example : (-126432 : ZMod 1235412223) ^ 12355342321 = 1001528716 := by reduce_mod_char
```
See the new tests for more examples. 

Co-authored-by: [Markus Himmel](https://github.com/TwoFX), [Quang Dao](https://github.com/quangvdao)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [cc4079e146](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18030/commits/cc4079e146e7e7ecd72e136b7dfa6934c2c72413)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.ReduceModChar` `Mathlib.Tactic`|1|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.NormNum.PowMod`|383|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CharP.isNat_pow`
`+ IsNatPowModT`
`+ IsNatPowModT.bit0`
`+ IsNatPowModT.bit1`
`+ IsNatPowModT.run`
`+ IsNatPowModT.trans`
`+ g`
`+ natPow_one_natMod`
`+ natPow_zero_natMod_one`
`+ natPow_zero_natMod_succ_succ`
`+ natPow_zero_natMod_zero`
`+ normBareNumeral`
`+ p`
`+ q`
`+ q'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I copied the test from `test/BinPow.lean` to here to demonstrate `reduce_mod_char` can handle largish numbers

The changes in `PowMod` seem straightforward. 

Pinging @Vierkantor as the original author for any thoughts on `ReduceModChar` changes (or any changes).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11488940997/job/31976742245)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11488940997/job/31976742659)
In the review I mostly focussed on the `ReduceModChar` part of the code and skimmed the `NormNum` part a bit more, but all of this looks good to me.
In the review I mostly focussed on the `ReduceModChar` part of the code and skimmed the `NormNum` part a bit more, but all of this looks good to me.

It's possible that these changes are bad and that `PowMod.lean` should also be changed, see [this comment](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9015#issuecomment-2136264087). Benchmarking may be required.
I reverted to the existing pattern since that I don't have to think about it. We can try some benchmarking on the lack of indirection in a later PR.
This is slightly out of scope but I think a very, very mild change, so ok.

```suggestion
  partial def normPow {α : Q(Type u)} (n n' : Q(ℕ)) (pn : Q(IsNat «$n» «$n'»)) (e : Q($α))
      (_ : Q(Ring $α)) (instCharP : Q(CharP $α $n)) : MetaM (Result e) := do
    let .app (.app (f : Q($α → ℕ → $α)) (a : Q($α))) (b : Q(ℕ)) ← whnfR e | failure
    let .isNat sα na pa ← normIntNumeral' n n' pn a _ instCharP | failure
    let ⟨nb, pb⟩ ← Mathlib.Meta.NormNum.deriveNat b q(instAddMonoidWithOneNat)
    guard <| withNewMCtxDepth <| isDefEq f q(HPow.hPow (α := $α))
    haveI' : $e =Q $a ^ $b := ⟨⟩
    haveI' : $f =Q HPow.hPow := ⟨⟩
    have ⟨c, r⟩ := evalNatPowMod na nb n'
    assumeInstancesCommute
    return .isNat sα c q(CharP.isNat_pow (f := $f) $instCharP (.refl $f) $pa $pb $pn $r)
```

```suggestion
  partial def normIntNumeral' {α : Q(Type u)} (n n' : Q(ℕ)) (pn : Q(IsNat «$n» «$n'»))
      (e : Q($α)) (_ : Q(Ring $α)) (instCharP : Q(CharP $α $n)) : MetaM (Result e) :=
    normPow n n' pn e _ instCharP <|> normBareNumeral n n' pn e _ instCharP
```

```suggestion
  normIntNumeral' n n' pn e _ instCharP
```
and make `(_ : Q(Ring $α))` the parameter. This also doesn't need to be `partial` though maybe it (and above) should remain so for psychological reasons.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Tactic/ReduceModChar): add fast modular exponentiation
